body.p:
Lexington, Ky. Nov, 26th. 1860
To His Excellency the Honl". B. McGoffin
Govener of. Kentucky
Dear. Sir

Enclosed I send you a petition for. your Clemency in the Case of Samuel Thompson for a Forfeited Recognizance Signed by all the official officers of the City -- Stating the facts in the case -- and as he is an expense to the City, would beg your Executive Clemency -- In truth he is an indolent but very harmless man, and of a very Respectable Family and has been confined in the City Work House for over Two months at hard labor which we think is sufficient punishment for his Offence as it was only for a forfeited Recognizance
Hoping that you will tender Your Executive Clemency

I remain
Yours. Most Respectfully
M. L. Keith Acting Marshall

PS
Your immediate attention is respectfully desired -- address as above & oblige

Respite 6 Mos
B. M
Lexington City Ct
$100. } Forfeited Recognizance
Saml Thompson
Issd Nov. 26. 1860
